title: Gauff and Williams Could Meet in Australian Open Second Round
snippets: Coco Gauff and Venus Williams could meet in the second round of the Australian Open, more than six years after they first played each other in a major. Jannik Sinner and Novak Djokovic landed in the same half of the draw, setting up a potential semifinal.

MELBOURNE, Australia — Coco Gauff and Venus Williams could meet in the second round of the Australian Open, more than six years after they first played each other in a major. Gauff was 15 when she beat seven-time major winner Venus Williams in the first round at Wimbledon in 2019 in her Grand Slam debut. Now she’s the No. 3 seed and a two-time major winner. The 45-year-old Williams has a wild-card entry for the Australian Open, where she’s playing for the first time in five years. Williams is set to become the oldest woman to compete in an Australian Open main draw, surpassing the record...

summary: Coco Gauff and Venus Williams could face each other in the second round of the 2026 Australian Open, marking their first major meeting since 2019. Gauff is now the No. 3 seed and a two-time major winner, while Williams, 45, enters as a wild card and is set to become the oldest woman to compete in the tournament's main draw. Jannik Sinner and Novak Djokovic are in the same half of the men's draw, allowing for a possible semifinal matchup.
